cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.SY, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the study of synchronizing automata, which is a topic in theoretical computer science and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The focus is on counting the number of symbol switches in synchronizing words, which is related to formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). The paper also involves the analysis of the complexity of synchronizing automata, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.CC). Additionally, the paper uses some algebraic and combinatorial techniques, which are relevant to the subfields of logic and discrete mathematics (cs.LO) and systems and control theory (cs.SY).
